headline: Birth Control That Few Are Able to Practice
Birth Control Beyond The Rhythm Method
Birth Control Device Returning for Sale in U.S.
snippet: LEAD: An intrauterine device that has not been sold in this country for more than a year will soon be available again, according to a nonprofit research group that holds the patent.

headline: Report on Birth Control Services Ranks Britain as World's Leader
snippet: LEAD: Britain leads the developed world in making birth control available to its people, and the United States ranks seventh, according to a report by a leading population control group.

headline: Birth Control Ad: The Fight for TV Time
snippet: LEAD: The television advertisement says: ''Four out of five young women who don't use birth control get pregnant before they want to. Birth control - from saying 'no' to taking the pill. You're too smart not to use it.'' The 30-second message is the...

headline: Spermicides Reported to Be Safe as Birth Control
snippet: LEAD: Two new studies have turned up no evidence that spermicides cause birth defects, and researchers say the findings should relieve lingering doubts about the safety of this form of birth control.

headline: Mincing No Words, or Pictures, on Birth Control
snippet: LEAD: Even in Washington, a city where causes are constantly in collision, the posters seem shocking.

headline: Dr. Karl Slotta, a Developer Of Birth Control Pills, Dies
snippet: LEAD: Karl Slotta, a biochemist whose work in the 1930s helped research that led to the development of birth control pills, died Friday at Doctor's Hospital here. He was 92 years old.

headline: Teachers Union Backs Birth Control Program
snippet: LEAD: The nation's largest teachers union today endorsed the distribution of contraceptives to students at school health clinics in an effort to reduce the incidence of teen-age pregnancy.

headline: On Knowledge, Will And Birth Control
TV, Sex and Birth Control
snippet: LEAD: Starting this month, television watchers in New York City and Buffalo can see yet another commercial featuring a handsome man, a pretty woman and music to go to bed by. But this commercial isn't selling detergent, jeans or diet soda. It's...

headline: Quinones Urges Birth-Control Clinics
snippet: LEAD: Schools Chancellor Nathan Quinones recommended yesterday that the New York City Board of Education continue to operate the eight high school health clinics that dispense birth-control prescriptions, and that the services be expanded to other...

headline: RESEARCHERS TEST BIRTH CONTROL INJECTION FOR MEN
snippet: LEAD: BEGINNING this spring, up to 400 men in countries around the world will begin to test a synthetic form of the male hormone testosterone as a form of birth control. Researchers hope the use of the hormone for contraception will one day rival the...

headline: Fake Birth Control Pills Lead to Indictment of 6
snippet: LEAD: Six Florida residents have been indicted in a scheme to distribute one million counterfeit birth control pills, the United States Attorney's office said today.
